Navigation
Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/Set/Difference

Synopsis The difference between two sets.
Syntax Exp1 - Exp2
Types
Exp1 Exp2 Exp1 - Exp2
set[T1] set[T2] set[lub(T1,T2)]
set[T1] T2 set[lub(T1,T2)]
T1 set[T2] set[lub(T1,T2)]
Description If both Exp1 and Exp2 have a set as value, the result is the difference of these two set values. If one of Exp1 or Exp2 does not have a set as value, it is first converted to a set before the difference is computed.
Examples 
rascal>{1, 2, 3, 4} - {1, 2, 3};
set[int]: {4}
rascal>{1, 2, 3, 4} - {3};
set[int]: {4,2,1}
rascal>{1, 2, 3, 4} - 3;
set[int]: {4,2,1}
rascal>{1, 2, 3, 4} - {5, 6, 7};
set[int]: {4,3,2,1}
Questions
Question 1. When you compute the difference of two sets, the number of elements in the result is always:
Smaller than or equal the number of elements in the first set.
Greater than the number of elements in both sets.
Greater than or equal the number of elements in the first set.
Smaller than the number of elements in both sets.

Question 2.
The type of {"Celery"} + {"Cumin", "S", "Guava"} is

Question 3.
The type of {18, -14, -19, -4, -2} - {18, -14, -19, -4, -2} is

Question 4. 
{-7, 15, 8, 17.5454030351947200, -1.182628263901794800} - {-2.068632567489658800} ==
